verses.verse: {Jerusalem is Rebuked} d A message {Lit. An oracle} concerning the Valley of Vision. {I. e. a poetic allusion to the Hinnom Valley in Jerusalem} "What troubles you, now that you've all gone up to the rooftops,
you who are full of commotion, you passionate city, you rollicking town? Your slain weren't killed by the sword, nor are they dead in battle.

All your leaders have fled together; she is captured {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads they were captured} without using bows. All of you who were caught were captured together, although they had fled while the enemy was still {The Heb. lacks while the enemy was still} far away.

Therefore I said: "Look away from me; and let me weep bitter tears; don't try to console {Lit. don't insist on consoling} me over the destruction of the daughter of my people." {I. e. the Lord's beloved people}

For to the Lord God of the Heavenly Armies belongs the day of tumult, trampling, and confusion in the Valley of Vision, {I. e. a poetic allusion to the Hinnom Valley in Jerusalem} and the pulling down of his Temple on {Or his Holy Place on ; so 1QIsa a ; MT reads and a crying out for help to} its mountain.
Elam takes up the quiver with chariots and cavalry, while Kir unsheathes the shield.
And it will come about {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads it came about} that your choicest valleys will be filled with chariots, and horsemen will take their positions at the gates.
He has uncovered the defenses of Judah." At that time, {Lit. On that day} you looked at the arsenal of the Palace of the Forest, {Cf. 1King 10:16-17}
and saw that there were many breaches in the City of David. So you stored up water from the Lower Pool,
counted the houses of Jerusalem, tore down certain houses to strengthen the wall,

and built a reservoir between the walls to store water from the Old Pool. But you did not look at {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX 4QIsa c read to} the One who did it, nor did you see the One who planned it long ago.
On that day the Lord G od of the Heavenly Armies called for weeping and mourning, for shaving heads {Lit. for baldness} and wearing sackcloth.

But look! There is joy and festivity, slaughtering of cattle and killing of sheep, eating meat and drinking {So 1QIsa a MT; 1QIsa c reads and they drink} wine. "Let us eat and drink, you say, because we die tomorrow."

"Nevertheless, the Lord of the Heavenly Armies has revealed himself to my hearing: "Surely because of you {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa c MT LXX lack because of you} this iniquity will not be forgiven you until you die,'says the Lord G od of the Heavenly Armies."

{The Lord Rebukes Shebna} d This is what the Lord God of the Heavenly Armies {So 1QIsa a MT; MT mss LXX read Lord of the Heavenly Armies} says: "Come, go to this steward, to Shebna who is in charge of the household, and ask him:

Â«What are you doing here, and who are your relatives here {Lit. whom do you have here} that you could carve out a grave for yourself here cutting out a tomb at the choicest location, {Lit. at the height} chiseling out a resting place for yourself out of solid rock?
Look Out! The Lord is about to hurl you away violently, my strong fellow! He {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa a 4QIsa b MT LXX read And he} will fold you up completely,

rolling you up tightly like a ball and throwing you into a large country. There {So 4QIsa f ; 1QIsa a 1QIsa b 4QIsa a MT read To there ; cf. LXX} you will die, and there {So 4QIsa f ; 1QIsa a 1QIsa b 4QIsa a MT read and to there ; cf. LXX} your splendid chariots will lie. You're a disgrace to your master's house!
I will depose you from your office, ousting you {Lit. he has ousted you ; so 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa f MT LXX ms read he will oust you ; LXX lacks he has ousted you} from your position.
"At that time, {Lit. On that day} I'll call for my servant, Hilkiah's {Lit. Hilkyah ; so 1QIsa a 4QIsa f} son Eliakim,

and I'll clothe him with your robe and fasten your sash around him. I'll transfer your authority to him, {Lit. to his hand} and he'll be a father to those who live in Jerusalem and to the house of Judah.
"I'll place on his shoulder the key to the house of David what he opens, no one will shut, and what he shuts, no one will open.
I'll set him like a peg into a secure place; he will become a throne of honor to his father's house.
The entire reputation of his father's house will hang on him: its offspring and offshoots all its smaller vessels, from the cups to all the jars.

At that time," {Lit. On that day} declares the Lord {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa a MT LXX; 4QIsa f reads the Lord God} of the Heavenly Armies, "the peg that was driven into a secure place will give way; it will be sheared and will fall, and the load hanging on it will be cut down." The Lord has spoken.
